title: Luck expected to play after throwing in pregame warmups - USA TODAY
text:
Luck expected to play after throwing in pregame warmups Andrew Luck active, expected to play after throwing during pregame warmups Post to Facebook Luck expected to play after throwing in pregame warmups Andrew Luck active, expected to play after throwing during pregame warmups Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/1LEt09c Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Luck expected to play after throwing in pregame warmups AP 7:13 p.m. EDT October 18, 2015 
INDIANAPOLIS (AP) — Colts quarterback Andrew Luck is active and expected to start Sunday night against New England. 
Luck missed the previous two games — the first two of his career — with an injured right shoulder. 
It appeared all week that Luck would play. During the previous two weeks, he was listed as a limited participant at practice. This week, Luck made more throws and twice was listed as a full participant. On Sunday, about three hours before kickoff, Luck was seen throwing with even more zip. 
But the bigger question is whether he will be healthy enough to snap Indy's six-game losing streak against the Patriots in the first meeting since the "Deflategate" controversy erupted after New England won January's AFC championship game. 
___
